revised_title: Advancements in Quantum Mechanical Methods and Computer Hardware for Modeling Solids and Surfaces
tldr: The article discusses the progress in computer hardware and quantum mechanical methods, enabling accurate calculations on complex systems. It highlights the development of computer architectures, processor speed, memory size, and storage devices, and their impact on computational solid state physics. The article also explores the role of three-dimensional graphics workstations and future developments in the field.
